Hey, Destin! I really like your channel and I think it would be really cool if you did an update on this video. The cashew tree is native to the northeast Brasil and was introduced to the rest of the world by the Portuguese. Today is largely grown in west Africa, India and in southeast Asia. The name "cashew" comes from the Portuguese word "caju", which comes from the native Brazilian language Tupi word "acayu". [Cashew is how someone from the USA would pronounce caju]
Also, the largest cashew tree in the world is in Natal, RN – Brasil. It has about 8.5 square km

I discovered what cashew plants and fruit looked like when I went to Brazil. For the longest time I wondered why everyone drinks the juice, but I rarely saw the fruit for sale, and in two years never saw anyone eat one. So I bought one and tried it. It was different. The flesh of the cashew apple is like a sponge. You don’t chew it, you suck the juice out of it. I didn’t try chewing and swallowing it, I just spat it out after sucking out the juice. Very different from any fruit I’ve seen.

Interesting video! Few people knows cashew nuts, many of them doesn't know where it comes from. I grew harvesting cashew and cashew nuts as an additional money income for living in Brazil. And when I was studying biology I learned that the fruit of cashew plants are the nuts, the yellow part that he was handling is, actually, a pseudo-fruit or accessory fruit. It is part of the stem that grows as a fruit. It can also be red, orange.

Btw, when I was a kid (10-ish) at my grandparent's, grandpa arrived with a bucket full of ripe cashews and we weren't allowed near them. I wanted to get to the nut so my dad explained to me that once I broke the "nut's" skin the oil inside it would slowly burn my hands and it would be very painful and very hard to get the oil out of my skin.

Hi Dustin, awesome videos.

The cashew is not really a fruit and the nut is not really a nut!

A true fruit is held onto the tree by a little stem, called the pedicel.

What you refer in your video as the "nut" is actually the fruit. The "nut" is inside and it is actually the seed.

In cashew trees the pedicel expands and develops into a sweet pulpy fruit-like thing but it does not contain the seed. It is called a pseudo-fruit.

Cashews are pranksters, they have fooled and confused humanity!
